H0.text: Trees are the organic material that, over a long time, can form oil when layers of sediment push down on them.

H1.text: Animals are the decomposing material that, over a long time, oil can form when layers of sediment push down on them.

H2.text: Fungi are the decomposing organisms that, over a long time, can form oil when layers of sediment push down on them.

H3.text: Algae are the material that, over a long time, can form oil when layers of sediment push down on them.

A4.text: Petroleum is a fossil fuel derived from fossilized organic materials, such as zooplankton and algae.
